intro: Ardisia geniculata, commonly known as the zigzag ardisia, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy red berries. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and seasonal fruiting, making it a popular choice in horticulture. Ardisia geniculata prefers shaded to partially shaded environments and well-drained soil.
